Properties

BypassCompositor

Whether to bypass the compositor. Defaults to true.

public bool BypassCompositor { get; set; }

Property Value

bool

Remarks

On Linux, the compositor re-buffers the application to apply various window effects, increasing latency in the process. Thus it is a good idea for games to bypass it, though normal applications would generally benefit from letting the window effects untouched.
If the SDL_VIDEO_X11_NET_WM_BYPASS_COMPOSITOR environment variable is set, this property will have no effect.

FriendlyGameName

The friendly name of the game to be hosted. This is used to display the name to the user, for example in the window title bar or in OS windows and prompts.

public string FriendlyGameName { get; set; }

Property Value

string

Remarks

If empty, GameHost will choose a default name based on the gameName.

IPCPort

The IPC port to bind. This port should be between 1024 and 49151, should be shared by all instances of a given osu!framework app, but be distinct from IPC ports specified by other osu!framework apps. See IIpcHost for more details on usage.

public int? IPCPort { get; set; }

Property Value

int?

PortableInstallation

Whether this is a portable installation. Will cause all game files to be placed alongside the executable, rather than in the standard data directory.

public bool PortableInstallation { get; set; }

Property Value

bool
